posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
The answer for q6 is wrong because you have not looked carefully at what the question is asking, and therefore your script is not answering the right question.

I will be solving this question in the next TA session, so you are welcome to join the session or watch the recording.

Regards

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
If you want help for your questions, you need to provide the quiz id. And please refrain from sending images of your scripts or code. Instead paste your actual script in preformatted tags.

eg.

someword="great";
echo "I check what's wrong with the output of the script. Wow this works $someword "

posts.name: Sneha Ramanathan
posts.cooked:
The quiz id is ad9dbe7c55414265a919ef4bf3629cce.

find . -type f -size +6418c -newermt '2024-04-23 06:03:00' -exec du -b {} + | awk '{total += $1} END {print "Total size in bytes:", total}'

This is the command I ran for Q4

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Typically disk usage which is in blocks rather than bytes is different from how many bytes a file is. A 3 byte file might still take 4KB on disk if the smallest disk block size is 4KB (default on NT)

You are getting the disk usage space which varies from computer to computer rather than answering the exact question that was asked.

Kind regards

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
A simpler solution is to simply use the ls -l command and send the output to a file, which can then be easily processed.

Of course you could use a bash script as well. But if you are not proficient in bash, it would very hard to diagnose what is wrong.

Why wield a samurai sword which requires great skill and experience to slice bread, when you can just do it with your kitchen bread knife instead?

Kind regards

posts.name: Anand S
posts.cooked: I suspect that’s because it was the command ChatGPT spewed out for the question
